ground_truth_articulation: The input is labeled True if it contains two or more exclamation marks.
generated_articulation:
# Classification Rule

**True if the text contains at least one exclamation mark (!); False otherwise.**

The rule is simply: classify as True when there is an exclamation mark present anywhere in the input text, and False when there are no exclamation marks.
raw_response:
# Classification Rule

**True if the text contains at least one exclamation mark (!); False otherwise.**

The rule is simply: classify as True when there is an exclamation mark present anywhere in the input text, and False when there are no exclamation marks.
llm_judge_reasoning: The Ground Truth rule classifies an input as True only if it contains two or more exclamation marks, requiring a minimum of two. The Generated Rule classifies an input as True if it contains at least one exclamation mark, regardless of how many. Therefore, they differ significantly in the key feature: the threshold for exclamation marks. The generated rule would classify many inputs with only one exclamation mark as True, which the ground truth would classify as False. They do not produce the same classifications on most inputs, and their core concepts are not equivalent.
